summary: Project to create an interactive motion video/animation that asks a question about roses being boring, with Yes/No branching and follow-up text/button interactions (Yes-branch message updated to: "You are right — here's tulips for you.").
architectural_notes: Do not include/ask the question "Will you be my valentine?" in the interaction flow; only use the roses-boring Yes/No branching flow.
Update required exact Yes-branch message string to: "You are right — here's tulips for you." (do not use "here's white tulips for you").

existing_features.title: Update the main interactive screen in `frontend/src/pages/ValentinePage.tsx` to present the question text exactly as: "Do you really think roses are boring?" and show two choices: "Yes" and "No".

Implement branching behavior for the Yes/No choices: when the user clicks "Yes", display a follow-up message exactly as: "You are right — here's white tulips for you." and visually emphasize white tulips (reuse existing tulip floating/confetti assets/animations already present in the project).

Implement the "No" branch: when the user clicks "No", show a message exactly as: "Please click yes, don't waste my labour" and replace the choices with a single visible "Yes" button (so the user can only proceed by clicking "Yes").
Ensure all user-facing text is in English and uses the exact casing/punctuation specified in the requirements for the three key texts (question, Yes-branch message, No-branch message).
Identify the exact cause of the current deployment/build failure and resolve it so the project can successfully build and deploy to the network.

Fix TypeScript build failures caused by unused imports or unused variables in the frontend codebase (for example, the unused `useState` import in `frontend/src/App.tsx` and any similar issues) so `npm run build` (or the platform’s equivalent) passes type-checking.

Ensure referenced static assets do not cause the deployment/build to fail by validating that all `/assets/generated/...` paths used by the UI exist at build time, or by adding safe fallbacks that prevent build-time failures when assets are missing.

Update the existing interactive screen so it does not ask “Will you be my Valentine?” anywhere in the visible primary flow, and ensure the motion-style interaction matches the user’s requested roses question flow (question + Yes/No branching), with all user-facing text in English and aligned to the required exact strings already specified for the roses question and its Yes/No outcomes.

Add a small playful “twist” micro-interaction to the existing roses-boring Yes/No flow on `frontend/src/pages/ValentinePage.tsx` that makes the interaction feel more fun without changing the required primary text strings or the Yes/No branching outcomes.
Update the website/page name shown in the browser tab by changing the HTML document title in `frontend/index.html` to a clearly editable app name string.

Add a short developer-facing documentation note explaining exactly where to change the website name in this codebase (including `frontend/index.html`), and if any runtime title-setting is introduced, document that location as well.
Change the website name shown to users (browser tab title) from "Valentine Interactive" to "Siddharth" by updating the HTML document title in `frontend/index.html`.
Update developer documentation in `frontend/README.md` so the displayed "Current Title" reflects the new website name "Siddharth".

Update the Yes-branch follow-up message shown after clicking “Yes” so it does not say “here's white tulips for you” anywhere, and instead displays the exact English string: "You are right — here's tulips for you." (including the em dash and trailing period).
